body:
@merlimat Yeh, I'm OK with that, I would install the same version on my current dev box though. Let's see how it goes.

@Licht-T I think we should merge this first so that anybody can easily try variety of clang-format options. But you can open a new PR for applying new format now, and it would be the best place for discussion about the options.

@Licht-T I'm having problem with cmake on MacOS to get it to fine the `clang-format` path (I installed with brew): 

```
[Errno 2] No such file or directory
CLANG_FORMAT_BIN-NOTFOUND -i /Users/mmerli/prg/pulsar/pulsar-client-cpp/lib/UnAckedMessageTrackerEnabled.cc /Users/mmerli/prg/pulsar/pulsar-client-cpp/lib/BatchMessageId.cc /Users/mmerli/prg/pulsar
...
```

fyi - this is a temporary change to allow me using the latest apache/bookkeeper version in a new module I am working on for pulsar. I created a follow up issue #1053 for moving zk/bk back to dependency management after pulsar starts using latest apache/bookkeeper version.
+1 on `configuration-store`
@merlimat addressed comments.
I am not sure if this is a good idea to move it out from dependency-management for development testing. and for dev testing, can't we always override maven-version into specific module's pom.?
@rdhabalia I tried with override version. it didn't work, because it seems that dependency management enforces version selection even the dependency is a transitive dependency.
retest this please
retest this please

@merlimat Okay, I've made the updates you requested. At the moment I'm still having trouble connecting to the cluster using external clients (the internal client from the `pulsar-admin` pod works fine). I'll take another look tomorrow.
@merlimat @sijie can you guys review.  Thanks!

@merlimat When flushing writing multiple messages they are sort of queued inside a `ChannelOutboundBuffer` which is a sort of linked list, this could cause allocations as well, I really don't know which is better.

I think it's more troublesome to have it as a holder, we would have to change a lot of files with probably little benefit.
The changes I made here should be the same or slightly better than previously
@maskit Okay! I'll create a new PR!
retest this please
It seems it a bit hard to write a test case for this. I will leave it for now. If a test is preferred, I will try to write one.
@merlimat Would you please merge into master? I want to do another work after this merged.
I will fix after https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/pull/1033 merged.
Sounds good. Let's merge this and then I'll check how easy is to get rid of `DoubleByteBuf`
@sijie @merlimat ping
@merlimat @sijie could I get a review on this?
Based on #1039, only the second commit should be reviewed here
@merlimat can you merge this? I don't have permissions

> can you merge this? I don't have permissions

There are some tests failing (otherwise you should be able to merge). I think they're not related to the `DoubleByteBuf` change, though they might be releated to the netty upgrade to 4.1.19
retest this please
retest this please
retest this please
@merlimat This is now ready for review

> There are some tests failing (otherwise you should be able to merge). I think they're not related to the DoubleByteBuf change, though they might be releated to the netty upgrade to 4.1.19

Shall i leave netty upgrade to another PR? We probably need to update yahoo/bookkeeer to 4.1.19 as well.

I thought I had merge permissions as well @merlimat but it seems I don't

> Shall i leave netty upgrade to another PR? 

Yes, at least it should fix the failing tests.

>We probably need to update yahoo/bookkeeer to 4.1.19 as well.

That it's not strictly necessary, since we manage the netty version in our pom and only our version gets included in the distribution.

> I thought I had merge permissions as well @merlimat but it seems I don't 

Can you check a different PR that is already approved and with tests passing to see if you have the green merge button? Eg: https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/pull/1038

> Can you check a different PR that is already approved and with tests passing to see if you have the green merge button? Eg: #1038

No merge button, only comment

> Yes, at least it should fix the failing tests.

Done

retest this please
rebased master to fix conflicts.

retest this please
retest this please
retest this please
@sschepens I am tring to port this change to bookkeeper, but I think there is a problem, see https://github.com/apache/bookkeeper/pull/996
Going to wait for #1066 so the algorithm can be made async.
retest this please
@sschepens Regarding the merge access, probably you have check again https://gitbox.apache.org/setup/

> @sschepens Regarding the merge access, probably you have check again https://gitbox.apache.org/setup/

I was missing the apache foundation invitation, found it :+1:
@merlimat we need to change this in yahoo's fork of bookkeeper as well, I made a PR https://github.com/yahoo/bookkeeper/pull/16
Thanks, I forgot we had the same `DoubleByteBuf` in BK code as well. (still looking to get rid of it.. :) )
... and I guess that was what was making the ManagedLedger failing when upgrading Netty to 4.1.19 in this PR.

@sschepens I'm seeing some failures in the test that seem to be related with the change: 


For example: 

https://builds.apache.org/job/pulsar-pull-request/org.apache.pulsar$pulsar-broker/1124/testReport/junit/org.apache.pulsar.client.api/TlsProducerConsumerTest/testTlsLargeSizeMessage/


```
5285 [pulsar-client-io-68-1] INFO org.apache.pulsar.client.impl.ProducerImpl - [persistent://my-property/use/my-ns/my-topic1] [use-0-0] Created producer on cnx [id: 0x60f1d8e5, L:/127.0.0.1:42258 - R:localhost/127.0.0.1:15003]
5285 [pulsar-client-io-68-1] INFO org.apache.pulsar.client.impl.ProducerImpl - [persistent://my-property/use/my-ns/my-topic1] [use-0-0] Re-Sending 1 messages to server
5287 [pulsar-client-io-68-1] WARN org.apache.pulsar.client.impl.ClientCnx - [id: 0x60f1d8e5, L:/127.0.0.1:42258 - R:localhost/127.0.0.1:15003] Exception caught: readerIndex(16384) + length(16384) exceeds writerIndex(16429): DoubleByteBuf(ridx: 16384, widx: 16429, cap: 16429, components=2)
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: readerIndex(16384) + length(16384) exceeds writerIndex(16429): DoubleByteBuf(ridx: 16384, widx: 16429, cap: 16429, components=2)
	at io.netty.buffer.AbstractByteBuf.checkReadableBytes0(AbstractByteBuf.java:1396)
	at io.netty.buffer.AbstractByteBuf.checkReadableBytes(AbstractByteBuf.java:1383)
	at io.netty.buffer.AbstractByteBuf.skipBytes(AbstractByteBuf.java:924)
	at io.netty.handler.ssl.SslHandler.wrap(SslHandler.java:876)
	at io.netty.handler.ssl.SslHandler.wrap(SslHandler.java:694)
	at io.netty.handler.ssl.SslHandler.wrapAndFlush(SslHandler.java:666)
	at io.netty.handler.ssl.SslHandler.flush(SslHandler.java:647)

```

Mm so it is better to revert that change from bk too I guess.
@merlimat @sijie
We have to.keep only the isDirect() change
@eolivelli yes, i already created a PR for bk

@eolivelli as @merlimat  suggested, it would be better to get rid of `DoubleByteBuf` and just keep a holder of the two byte bufs and write them both to the channel before flushing, this should be the most optimal.

I am going to pick you your latest change as I am going to cut I minor release for BK.
The idea of dropping DBB is ok for me but maybe we will add it for 4.7.0 without hurru.
Thank you.
I have to run bk with latest version of netty and this change is great for me
https://github.com/hangqi/node-hedwig can be a good reference for implementing a nodejs client.
retest this please

> @eolivelli as @merlimat suggested, it would be better to get rid of DoubleByteBuf and just keep a holder of the two byte bufs and write them both to the channel before flushing, this should be the most optimal.

>  The idea of dropping DBB is ok for me but maybe we will add it for 4.7.0 without hurru. 

I just checked and the change is a bit complex for BK code. The reason is that there are places in which we are actually concatenating 3 buffers. So yes, I'd say to apply this minimal change for now and rethink later for 4.7.  

@sschepens I have the DBB refactoring in #1078
retest this please
retest this please

These chances are great, I was thinking of making similar ones today.
Maybe se could replace `coalesce` with a method only available forma tests, to make ir clear that it should only be used for tests
retest this please
cc/ @lucperkins
cc/ @lucperkins
Added PR in #1077

Either option (1) or (2) would be good. Ideally (2) but I don't know how difficult that would be. 

Do you still have the exception/error that is generated?
Fixed in #1065
Fixed in #1025

Tests seem to pass, the only thing I'm concerned with is reference counting, we're not retaining the buffers when we get a `ByteBufPair` but we're releasing them when we release the pair, but when writing the bufs they should released as well, I think there would be a double free, but I could be wrong

A few notes for reviewers:

This is the latest option list. Some may be not available on 4.0 and/or other versions but it would be a good discussion point if we found any that we want.
https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormatStyleOptions.html

Because there are tons of small changes, we might miss some changes that we don't want. Applying too much options at once may cuts your own throat. Maybe some options should be applied later separately.

Finally, please do not start wars. There is no one answer.
Fixed in #998

@Licht-T @maskit The other thing I'm thinking is that if most devs are anyway on MacOs, we should use the `clang-format-5.0` that comes with homebrew to make it easier for people to setup the env. 

For Linux, the version we install in the Docker image, we can always adjust it, even if it doesn't come as a deb/rpm package already.
This is depending on #1078 and upgrading the Netty version, since the current tc-native artifact library doesn't work with netty-4.1.12 but it's working in netty-4.1.19
@sebbASF the page was updated a couple of weeks back, can you give it another look? Thanks
retest this please
@sschepens Closing this in favor of #1078

@merlimat @rdhabalia @saandrews - please review this whenever you find time 

I am open to exchanging PR reviews too as an incentive to get this checked in :-P
Replied in mailing list
retest this please

> @merlimat Would you please merge into master? I want to do another work after this merged.

Yup, I lost track of this PR...
Thanks!
I am starting looking at this one (just in case on other people is working on it).

@lucperkins There are a couple of files missing ASF headers. You can do `mvn license:format` to fix it. 
```
[WARNING] Missing header in: /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/pulsar-pull-request/kubernetes/google-kubernetes-engine/proxy.yaml
[WARNING] Missing header in: /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/pulsar-pull-request/kubernetes/google-kubernetes-engine/cluster-metadata.yaml
```
retest this please
retest this please

Overall the changes and the idea LGTM 
I guess we should ignore the protobuf headers and cc files during formatting - since they are auto generated
retest this please
LGTM

@merlimat 

> The other thing I'm thinking is that if most devs are anyway on MacOs, we should use the clang-format-5.0 that comes with homebrew to make it easier for people to setup the env.

Sounds reasonable, installability on other platforms should be considered too though (3.8 is also available on Homebrew).

> For Linux, the version we install in the Docker image, we can always adjust it, even if it doesn't come as a deb/rpm package already.

Good point. CI environment is controllable. This makes things simple.

As I wrote previously:

"KEYS, sigs and hashes must be linked from www.apache.org/dist/... and should use https."

Only KEYS currently links to www.apache.org/dist/incubator/pulsar and it does not use https.
The links to the sigs and hashes currently don't work at all as such files are not mirrored.

The older releases section links to the correct host. However the hashes and sigs should use https.

The page should also mention the need to check releases against the sig or failing that a hash.
For example, see how Tomcat does it:

https://tomcat.apache.org/download-90.cgi#Release_Integrity
@merlimat @maskit Using `clang-format-5.0` is reasonable option. But, it is better to arrange the both versions in CI and local because we want to do `make check-format` on CI.

@merlimat  @rdhabalia  - This last PR addresses all outstanding concerns we had discussed in the mail chain. 

Only @msb-at-yahoo suggestions remain - which will be addressed as a separate PR once this is merged since the suggestions are still under discussion.

@ivankelly making it async is just the optimization I suggest. I think we don't need to be blocked by #1066. let's first get this compaction algo move forward, we can optimize this implementation later. my major comment is around the queue usage, you don't need to do rate limiting here, because pulsar client would do rate limiting itself.
Changes LGTM - can merge this PR if @merlimat comments are addressed.
